ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritix in Eclipse
ygData.msgSnippet: Especially if you re customizing Heritrix (as seems to be the case from setting up a dev environment), you should be basing your work off of Heritrix

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritix in Eclipse
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=sm3IrRM52BMEKRJa7vDmoF25mq3Ukk4C8mJWjuDWjqzO
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Especially if you're customizing Heritrix (as seems to be the case from 
setting up a dev environment), you should be basing your work off of 
Heritrix 3.0.0/heritrix3 trunk (aka 'H3').

H3 is the main focus of our development going forward, and its 
Spring-based configuration offers easier opportunities for incremental 
extension.

It's also best to work from an SVN checkout, as the working source tree 
has Eclipse project-support files (.project, .classpath) as used by the 
Heritrix core team.

So my suggestions would be:

  - discard any prior projects

  - make sure your Eclipse install includes SVN and Maven support

  - create a new project, SVN->"Checkout projects from SVN", using URL
 
https://archive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/trunk/heritrix3

  - attempt one Maven2 install build from that checkout, to trigger 
population of your local M2_REPO with all necessary 3rd-party libraries

  - if Eclipse seems not to recognize paths it should, try one or all of:
    - 'refresh' menupick on project
    - restarting Eclipse
    - toggling the 'build automatically' or 'clean...' options

These Ubuntu-centric notes from my colleague Steve may be helpful, 
though they are still explicitly only regarding H1/H2:

  https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/~siznax/Heritrix+in+Eclipse

If anyone can verify/update these prior guides to work with H3, bringing 
a developer from ground state to a working Eclipse H3 dev project, 
that'd be greatly appreciated.

- Gordon @ IA

On 8/21/10 12:57 PM, Ewa Bartosiewicz wrote:
> Can someone help me with configuring heritrix 2.0.2 in Eclipse? I read this: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Setting+up+the+new+Heritrix+in+Eclipse and even tried to read this: http://www.codeweblog.com/to-build-heritrix-in-eclipse/
> but I still can't cope with it.
> I built the src project with maven, I set the M2_REPO variable and am trying to build the project in eclipse. I get hundreds of errors like:
>
> _authority cannot be resolved	LaxURI.java	/heritrix-src/project/commons/src/main/java/org/archive/net	line 187	
> _host cannot be resolved or is not a field	UURI.java	/heritrix-src/project/commons/src/main/java/org/archive/net	line 305
> ARecord cannot be resolved to a type	FetchDNS.java	/heritrix-src/project/modules/src/main/java/org/archive/modules/fetcher	line 340
> ...
>
> as if the project couldn't see the libraries.
>
> should I add something more to the build path? should I set any other configurations? do I need the other heritrix source in eclipse (the built one)?
>
> I would be really grateful for a step-by-step for tutorial for idiots...
>
>
> Regards,
> Ewa
